channel.title: Hitchcock on Let's see what happens.
channel.description: Recent content in Hitchcock on Let's see what happens.

item.title: Dial M for Murder
item.description:
I’ve been watching some Hitchcock and I had to have a post about this movie. In my limited experience, I don’t see the director messing with the viewer and instead it’s very classy cinema. The problem is that there is nothing to add in terms of arbitrary writing.

The movie is cold and smart, but after M proper I’ve enjoyed To Catch a Thief more. Also a movie set in France must be superior a priori. So I must forget the title and write something about To Catch a Thief instead.

item.title: Psycho
item.description: It’s The Birds fairy tale edition. With own dark forest and lost maidens.

item.title: The Birds
item.description:
I can’t choose what I like more in this cinema. I can enjoy both it’s ambiguity and balance/sanity of how it is made.

It’s a classy and original take on the same subject as Hereditary. Hereditary does on it some funny references I’d say.

Good cinema medium is so dense and these coincidences of watching so related movies on consecutive days really makes it feel magical.
